Article Title: Meerut: Man kills kin for Rs 50cr insurance; 4th wife exposes plot
Article Text:
Representative image

MEERUT: A man accused of murdering his first wife, father and mother to claim insurance worth Rs 50 crore has been arrested in Hapur, Uttar Pradesh, after his fourth wife alerted police about a series of suspicious deaths in the family.Vishal Singhal, 37, had already received Rs 1.5 crore in claims and was attempting to file more when police detained him along with his alleged accomplice. Singhal, a resident of Gangangar in Meerut, had convinced his fourth wife, Shreya, to sign multiple high-value life insurance policies.Her suspicions grew as she noticed patterns similar to those in reports she had read about an ongoing insurance scam being probed in Sambhal. When her concerns were dismissed by local police in Meerut, she reached out to the Sambhal police, who were already investigating fraud cases involving staged deaths across 11 states.
Article Summary: Vishal Singhal, 37, had already received Rs 1.5 crore in claims. He was attempting to file more when police detained him along with his alleged accomplice. Singhal convinced his fourth wife, Shreya, to sign multiple high- value life insurance policies.

Article Title: PM Modi's 'Operation Sindoor' post: Congress takes '3rd umpire' jibe, says battlefield comparison not appropriate
Article Text:
'Must Show Grace In Victory': Congress MP Shashi Tharoor On India’s Asia Cup Win Over Pakistan

Poll Do you think PM Modi's comparison of cricket to Operation Sindoor was appropriate? Yes, it was an appropriate analogy No, it was inappropriate

NEW DELHI: A day after the Indian cricket team won the Asia Cup Championship, political row erupted over PM Modi 's congratulatory remarks, with Congress terming the Operation Sindoor mention "inappropriate".Soon after the win, PM Modi posted on X last night saying, "#OperationSindoor on the games field. Outcome is the same - India wins! Congrats to our cricketers."The post drew flak from Congress, with Pawan Khera writing a direct post to PM Modi saying, "Prime Minister, firstly, comparing a cricket match to a battlefield is not appropriate." Further taking a jibe at the PM and indirectly hinting at Trump's repeated ceasefire claims, Khera added, "Secondly, if you must make such a comparison, you need to learn from the Indian team that when you’re close to victory, good captains don’t call for a ceasefire just because a third umpire says so. "This was the latest in series of back and forth among politicians. Earlier in the day, other Congress leaders had also taken jabs at the Prime minister. ""Sometimes I doubt if PM Modi has any knowledge of foreign policy and diplomacy. If we played, we should have played with sportsman spirit," Atul Londhe Patil told news agency PTI. ""If Operation Sindoor is ongoing, then we shouldn't have played. And if discussions are ongoing to normalise the situation, then sports can be a medium to improve it, but linking everything with Operation Sindoor is not right," Patil added.Maharashtra Congress president Harshvardhan Sakpal also reacted to the Prime Minister’s post. He said: “It is clear from his tweet that, be it air, water, or sports, he brings politics into everything to polarise. We take pride in India’s victory, but we haven't won the Asia Cup for the first time. There is a certain dignity of a country which he doesn't maintain, and I regret this.”Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for linking India’s Asia Cup victory over Pakistan with Operation Sindoor, warning that tournament proceeds could be diverted to fund terror activities across the border. Speaking to ANI, Chaturvedi had said that the Asia Cup games between India and Pakistan “should not have happened” in the first place, questioning why India chose to play Pakistan despite its stated “zero tolerance for terror” policy. “In the first place, this match should not have happened. The cricket match that BCCI played for the benefit of PCB... the match that took place for the revenue of the broadcasters. The 140 crore people of the country did not want this match to happen," she added.Also read: Congress slams PM Modi's post after India's Asia Cup win; row over playing match On the other hand, BJP had also taken jabs at Congress for not making a statement on India's win. "It seems India’s stunning win against Pakistan in the Asia Cup final has left Rahul Gandhi and the entire Congress in a comatose state. Just like after #OperationSindoor, when they couldn’t bring themselves to congratulate the Indian Army for its stupendous strikes, they now appear to be waiting for permission from Mohsin Naqvi and their other handlers in Pakistan before joining the nation in celebrating the Indian cricket team’s success," said Amit Malviya."Put that aside — not even a single social media post from Congress congratulating our national team for thrashing Pakistan thrice in the tournament and bringing the Asia Cup home. Once again, Pakistan, Rahul Gandhi, and Congress find themselves on the same side of the divide," he further added.India won the Asia Cup with the final against Pakistan on Sunday by 5 wickets.
Article Summary: India won the Asia Cup Championship against Pakistan on Sunday by 5 wickets. PM Modi posted on X last night saying, "#OperationSindoor on the games field. Outcome is the same - India wins! Congrats to our cricketers." The post drew flak from Congress, with Pawan Khera writing a direct post to PM Modi saying, "Prime Minister, firstly, comparing a cricket match to a battlefield is not appropriate"

Article Title: Illegal online gambling: ED Panaji conducts multi-state raids; seizes over Rs 2cr
Article Text:
Representative image

Vaishnaw Criticizes Opposition For Creating Chaos As Online Gaming Bill Is Passed

NEW DELHI: Acting against some casino operators and hoteliers for alleged illegal online gambling activities, Enforcement Directorate ’s Panaji office conducted searches across Goa, Delhi-NCR, Mumbai and Rajkot Sunday and Monday. ED seized more than Rs 2 crore in Indian currency, $14,000, cryptocurrency USDT worth Rs 90 lakh, and other foreign currencies worth Rs 8.5 lakh.“Use of angadia services through crypto wallets to facilitate USDT transfers to Dubai and other locations across the world was unearthed,” the agency said. The searches were targeted primarily at Golden Globe Hotels Pvt Ltd, Worldwide Resorts and Entertainment, and Big Daddy Casino in Goa and on premises of their promoters and beneficiaries.“Probe revealed rolex777.co, iCasino247.com, play247s.com, Win Daddy, Poker Daddy, among others were promoted by staff of the casino under Golden Globe Hotels,” ED said, adding accused provided poker chips to customers in lieu of foreign currency & winnings were disbursed in foreign currency.
Article Summary: Enforcement Directorate ’s Panaji office conducted searches across Goa, Delhi- NCR, Mumbai and Rajkot. ED seized more than Rs 2 crore in Indian currency, $14,000, cryptocurrency USDT worth Rs 90 lakh, and other foreign currencies worth Rs 8.5 lakh.

Article Title: Braelon Allen injury update: What happened to New York Jets RB that made him leave Monday Night Football game
Article Text:
Braelon Allen injury update (AP Photos)

Braelon Allen injury adds to Jets’ offensive concerns



What’s next for Braelon Allen and the Jets



The New York Jets were dealt an early setback on Monday Night Football when running back Braelon Allen exited with a knee injury in the second quarter against the Miami Dolphins. The rookie went down after taking a hard hit during a kickoff return and was quickly escorted to the medical tent before limping to the locker room. Moments later, the Jets officially ruled him out for the rest of the game.Allen’s night had started with promise. Before the injury, he carried the ball four times for 26 yards, showing flashes of power and patience. However, the momentum shifted when he lost a costly fumble at the goal line on New York’s opening drive. “As Braelon Allen ran off the field after the fumble, Aaron Glenn grabbed both sides of his helmet to console him and give him words of encouragement,” sideline reporter Katie George noted during the ESPN broadcast.The emotional toll was clear. “Allen then spent a lot of time pacing, sitting and standing alone. He was obviously gutted to lose the ball at the goal line. Now, he’s in some physical pain, as they look at his left knee in the injury tent,” George added.For the Jets, Allen’s absence leaves the backfield thinner than planned. With Breece Hall already carrying the bulk of the offense, Isaiah Davis is now expected to step into a larger role.The team will need both to stay sharp if they hope to keep pace in the AFC East.The concern now extends beyond Week 4. A knee injury severe enough to sideline Allen immediately raises questions about his availability moving forward. In the first three games of the season, the 20-year-old logged 14 carries for 50 yards and a touchdown, carving out a role behind Hall.The Jets will await further testing to determine the severity of the injury. Losing Allen for an extended stretch would not only hurt New York’s depth but also slow the development of a rookie who was beginning to find his rhythm in the league.Also Read: Jake Browning’s fiancée Stephanie Niles turns heads with her unusual Bengals look ahead of Broncos clash
Article Summary: New York Jets running back Braelon Allen suffered a knee injury in the second quarter against the Miami Dolphins. The rookie went down after taking a hard hit during a kickoff return and was quickly escorted to the medical tent before limping to the locker room. The Jets will await further testing to determine the severity of the injury.

Article Title: The moment when Mohsin Naqvi stormed out of the ground with Asia Cup trophy - watch video
Article Text:
Mohsin Naqvi insisted on presenting the medals. He then instructed the Asia Cup trophy be removed when India didn't budge (Images via AP & X/Screengrabs)

Inside details of how PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi ran away with the Asia Cup trophy!

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

An official removes the winners' trophy from the presentation area after India won the Asia Cup cricket final against Pakistan at Dubai International Cricket Stadium (AP Photo/Altaf Qadri)

Poll Do you think India should have accepted the trophy from Mohsin Naqvi? Yes, it was just a formality No, a neutral official should present it

A video that surfaced on social media showed Asian Cricket Council (ACC) chief and Pakistan minister Mohsin Naqvi leaving the stadium in protest after India refused to accept the Asia Cup 2025 trophy and winners’ medals from his hands.Naqvi, who is also the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief, had waited on the podium for the post-match presentation. However, the Indian team, led by Suryakumar Yadav, refused to receive the trophy or medals, requesting that a neutral official hand them over instead.After discussions failed to resolve the situation, Naqvi walked off the stage. Officials were later seen taking the trophy away from the podium as well. The video brought to light the tense and unexpected moment, which brought the post-match ceremony to a halt.Speaking at the post-match press conference, India captain Suryakumar Yadav expressed disbelief at the incident. “This is one thing which I have never seen since I started playing cricket, started following cricket—a champion team is denied a trophy, that too a hard-earned one,” he said.“I feel we deserved it. And I can't say anything more. If you tell me about trophies, mine are sitting in the dressing room, all 14 guys with me, the support staff—those are the real trophies throughout this journey in the Asia Cup.”The BCCI has decided to lodge a formal protest with the International Cricket Council (ICC) against Naqvi’s actions. Despite the controversy, the Indian players celebrated their historic win on the field, even without the trophy in hand.On the pitch, India clinched clinched the 2025 Asia Cup title with a thrilling five-wicket victory over Pakistan. Riding on Tilak Varma’s unbeaten 69 off 53 balls and a vital 33 from Shivam Dube, India chased down a target of 147 with two balls to spare.Earlier, Pakistan had posted 146 all out in 19.1 overs, despite solid contributions from Sahibzada Farhan (57) and Fakhar Zaman (46). Indian spinners Kuldeep Yadav (4/30), Varun Chakravarthy (2/30), and Axar Patel (2/26) triggered a collapse that saw Pakistan lose their last nine wickets for just 33 runs. Jasprit Bumrah also chipped in with 2/25.This marked India’s third win over Pakistan in this edition of the tournament, following victories in the league and Super Fours stages. While the trophy controversy overshadowed the post-match proceedings, the Indian team’s performance on the field was a clear statement of dominance.
Article Summary: India beat Pakistan by five wickets in the 2025 Asia Cup cricket final. Mohsin Naqvi waited on the podium for the post-match presentation. However, the Indian team refused to receive the trophy or medals. After discussions failed to resolve the situation,Naqvi walked off the stage. Officials were later seen taking the trophy away from the podium.

Who is Gianna Carmona? The model and TikTok star linked to Justin Fields

The alleged love story: How the dating rumors started between Justin Fields and Gianna Carmona

Article Title: "He stayed the same": Gisele Bündchen opens up about why she left Leonardo DiCaprio after years of an on-and-off relationship
Article Text:
Gisele Bundchen opens up about separating from Leonardo DiCaprio.(Image via Nino Muñoz, Jesse Grant / Getty Images for AFI)

Gisele Bündchen opens up about her high profile relationship with Leonardo DiCaprio



Gisele Bündchen Reveals Why She Broke Up With Leonardo DiCaprio in 2005

Gisele Bündchen knew Tom Brady was special on their first date



Gisele Bündchen , the former Victoria’s Secret model, and Tom Brady’s ex wife, has built a new life for herself ever since she separated from the NFL legend. But the path to a meaningful life was not very easy for the Brazilian supermodel. Gisele Bündchen has opened up about having suicidal thoughts when she was young and even about her high profile relationship with popular Hollywood actor, Leonardo DiCaprio A few years ago, Gisele Bündchen penned a memoir titled Lessons: My Path to a Meaningful Life in 2018, where she opened up about her high profile relationship with Leonardo DiCaprio and why it ended.Gisele Bündchen wrote, “No longer numbing myself with smoking, drinking and too much work, I was becoming more and more aware of things that I’d chosen not to look at. Was I alone in wanting to do some serious soul-searching while [Leonardo DiCaprio] stayed the same? In the end, unfortunately, the answer was yes.”Later, when the former Victoria’s Secret model spoke to PEOPLE about her break up with Leondardo DiCaprio, she said, “Everyone who crosses our path is a teacher. They come into our lives to show us something about ourselves…”Gisele Bündchen added, “And I think that’s what he was.What is good versus bad? I honour him for what he was."Much before Gisele Bündchen met the NFL legend Tom Brady, she was in a pretty high profile relationship with Leonardo DiCaprio from 2000 to 2005.The relationship was not a stable one and as per reports, the two did break up a few times in the middle, ultimately ending their relationship in 2005 and going their separate ways.In 2006, Gisele Bündchen ended up meeting Tom Brady and she knew he was the one for her on their first date itself after the two went on a blind date, shortly after the former Victoria's Secret model broke up with Leonardo DiCaprio.The two got married in 2009 and Gisele Bündchen stepped away from her successful career in modelling to focus on the family she was building with Tom Brady and their two children.Despite the love and commitment they had for one another, Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen divorced in 2022 and now, she lives a comfortable life with her boyfriend, Joaquim Valente.Also Read: "My world turned upside down": Gisele Bündchen opens up about finding out Tom Brady fathered a child with an ex weeks into their relationship

Article Title: Jake Browning’s fiancée Stephanie Niles turns heads with her unusual Bengals look ahead of Broncos clash

Stephanie Niles shines bright as Jake Browning prepares for Monday Night Football spotlight (Stephanie Niles/ Instagram)

Jake Browning’s fiancée Stephanie makes bold fashion statement before high-stakes Monday Night Football game



Stephanie Niles’ quirky game-day style steals spotlight as she cheers Jake Browning during Bengals vs. Broncos showdown (Stephanie Niles/TikTok)

Jake Browning faces big test for Bengals against Broncos

Article Title: Shedeur Sanders’ mom Pilar unleashes bold response after Rex Ryan crushes Browns rookie quarterback on live TV
Article Text:
Pilar Sanders fiercely defends son Shedeur after Rex Ryan brutally criticizes Browns rookie quarterback on ESPN (Imagn Images)

Shedeur Sanders earns fan love despite Rex Ryan’s criticism



Pilar Sanders’ powerful Instagram message goes viral



Shedeur Sanders has many admirers across the NFL , but none stand taller in his corner than his family. So when ESPN analyst and former New York Jets head coach Rex Ryan publicly criticized the Cleveland Browns rookie quarterback, it was only a matter of time before Shedeur’s mother, Pilar Sanders, came forward with a fiery response.Deion Sanders’ son is already one of the league’s most popular young players, with Browns fans eagerly buying his jersey and hoping he eventually replaces veteran Joe Flacco. While head coach Kevin Stefanski seems more inclined to test rookie Dillon Gabriel, much of the fanbase sees Shedeur as the future. That optimism, however, clashed with Ryan’s blunt remarks on ESPN’s Get Up.“This kid talks and he runs his mouth,” Ryan said, mocking Shedeur’s confidence. “Like he said, ‘I can be a starting quarterback’ with his arms crossed like this. Get your ass in the front row and study and do all that. If I know, the whole league knows. Quit being an embarrassment that way. You’ve got the talent to be the quarterback, you should be. You should be embarrassed that you’re not the quarterback now.”Ryan’s words quickly made waves, but Pilar Sanders wasted no time striking back with passion.Pilar took to Instagram to defend her son, sharing a scathing post aimed directly at Ryan. “To young Athletes and Football fans... This is what impotent, cancerous, envious energy looks like,” she wrote. “This type of Evile [sic] goes waaay back – you can cut it with a knife – embedded in blood and bones seeping through all of the rotting worm holes [sic] it has. What and who does he really represent? Its’ family and peers should be embarrassed to know and let this on their platforms. There's no room for this type in sports. Please 🤫... Tsk tsk tsk... Enuff!”She followed with a simple caption: “Sad…”Her words struck a chord, resonating with fans who believe Shedeur deserves patience and support rather than public ridicule. The episode also highlighted how fiercely protective his family remains, especially as he battles to carve out his place in the NFL spotlight.Stay tuned, because as this back-and-forth shows, criticizing Shedeur Sanders might just unleash a storm. And if there’s one lesson here, it’s clear: never underestimate a mother’s defense of her son.Also Read: “Having heart failure”: Giants fan defends herself after viral backlash for taking Patrick Mahomes’ headband from young boy

Article Title: “Having heart failure”: Giants fan defends herself after viral backlash for snatching Patrick Mahomes’ headband from young boy
Article Text:
A Kansas City Chiefs game moment turned controversial. Patrick Mahomes tried to give his headband to a young fan. A Giants supporter, Nina Miller, took the item instead. A viral video showed the incident. Miller later issued an apology for her actions. She claimed misunderstanding the situation. The event sparked debate on fan conduct. This incident highlights sportsmanship issues.

The viral video that sparked the “Kansas City Karen” nickname

Nina Miller issues apology but fans question her sincerity

The Kansas City Chiefs’ road victory against the New York Giants on September 21 at MetLife Stadium made headlines for more than just the game. A post-game moment involving Patrick Mahomes , a young fan, and an adult Giants supporter has spiraled into one of the season’s most talked-about viral controversies.After the game, Patrick Mahomes was spotted greeting fans and appeared to hand his game-worn headband to a 10-year-old Chiefs supporter who was celebrating his birthday. However, in a video that spread rapidly across social media, Nina Miller, a Giants fan wearing team gear, was seen taking the headband before the child could secure it.The clip drew immediate outrage, with fans dubbing her the “Kansas City Karen.” Internet sleuths quickly tracked Miller’s social accounts, uncovering a now-deleted video where she bragged about the keepsake. This fueled the perception that the act was intentional and not a misunderstanding.Amid mounting backlash, Miller posted a TikTok video on September 27, claiming the moment was chaotic. “Everyone is having heart failure over this,” she said, emphasizing that fans from multiple rows had rushed the front.She argued that she “paid for” her seat and didn’t realize the headband was meant for the boy.In a follow-up video the next day, Miller softened her tone, explaining, “At the game, with all the noise and all the excitement, I honestly thought that Pat Mahomes was giving me the headband. I reached for it without thinking.” She admitted later learning it was intended for the young fan’s birthday and added, “I’m sorry that I ruined your moment. You should have had your moment for your birthday.”She also asked for help connecting with the boy’s family to mail him the souvenir. Still, many fans dismissed her statement as damage control. One top comment summed up the skepticism: “‘I’m sorry I got caught.’”Also Read: Brittany Mahomes admits Patrick Mahomes was just a joke crush before their relationship turned serious What could have been a heartwarming birthday memory for a young Chiefs fan instead turned into a firestorm about fan behavior and sportsmanship. Whether Miller’s apology leads to reconciliation remains to be seen, but the incident underscores how quickly moments at games can turn into viral debates about respect and fairness in sports culture.
Article Summary: Patrick Mahomes tried to give his headband to a young fan. Giants supporter, Nina Miller, took the item instead. A viral video showed the incident. Miller later issued an apology for her actions. She claimed misunderstanding the situation. This incident highlights sportsmanship issues.

Article Title: “Very bad information”: Charlie Kirk attacked Taylor Swift’s politics and Travis Kelce romance before his assassination
Article Text:
Charlie Kirk, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce (Getty Images)

Charlie Kirk questioned Taylor Swift’s political post and dismissed her knowledge

Unseen Video Of Charlie Kirk's Killing; How ‘Assassin’ Tyler Went From ‘Diehard Trump’ To ‘Hater’

Years later, Charlie Kirk turned his criticism on Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s relationship

Back in 2018, Charlie Kirk — the outspoken founder of Turning Point USA — used his national platform to lash out at Taylor Swift after the pop star broke her silence on politics. Years later, his assassination in 2025 has reframed those moments as part of his long history of targeting cultural icons like Swift and, more recently, her fiancé Travis Kelce Taylor Swift shocked fans in October 2018 when she endorsed Democrat Phil Bredesen for Senate in Tennessee and spoke out against Republican candidate Marsha Blackburn, saying her record “appalls and terrifies me.” She urged fans to register to vote and added, “I always have and always will cast my vote based on which candidate will protect and fight for the human rights I believe we all deserve in this country.”Kirk, then just 24, appeared on Fox and Friends to undermine Swift’s words. “I don’t want to accuse her of this, but I don’t think she’s the only one who wrote that post on Instagram. She probably got some very bad information,” he said, suggesting she wasn’t capable of forming her own opinions. He also accused her of turning away from her brand, saying, “This is what I used to love about Taylor Swift is she stayed away from politics — she was all about music, all about female empowerment. ”On Twitter, Kirk went further, writing, “You have absolutely no idea what you are talking about.Your career has never recovered since Kanye ended it.”That early clash foreshadowed Kirk’s later attacks. In 2025, after Swift’s engagement to Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce, Kirk once again went after her, this time urging her to “submit to your husband Taylor” and mocking her career by saying he couldn’t wait for a “Taylor Kelce concert.” His remarks drew widespread backlash as sexist and bizarre, reinforcing how frequently he used Swift as a cultural punching bag.Also Read: “She ain’t Mother Mary”: Charlie Kirk’s more attacks on Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce resurfaces after his shocking assassination Now, with Charlie Kirk assassinated at a Utah campus event in 2025, those old comments resurface as part of his legacy, one built on provocative culture-war battles. His criticisms of Taylor Swift and even her relationship with Travis Kelce reveal just how much he saw her influence as a political threat. What began in 2018 with a swipe at her Instagram post ended years later as one of the defining feuds of his career and one that continues to echo long after his death.
Article Summary: In 2018, Charlie Kirk lashed out at Taylor Swift after she broke her silence on politics. His assassination in 2025 has reframed those moments as part of his long history of targeting cultural icons. In 2025, after Swift’s engagement to Kansas City Chiefs star Travis Kelce, Kirk once again went after her.

Article Title: Will Bengals survive without Joe Burrow? Latest injury news raises uncertainty about quarterback’s future this season
Article Text:
Will Joe Burrow return this season? (Getty Images)

Joe Burrow’s injury update and timeline for return



Impact on Bengals’ season and playoff chances without Joe Burrow



The Cincinnati Bengals are once again staring at uncertainty after quarterback Joe Burrow suffered a severe turf toe injury that required surgery. The timing could not be worse, as the team’s playoff hopes now hang in the balance while their franchise player faces an extended recovery.Joe Burrow went down in Week 2 against the Jacksonville Jaguars and was later diagnosed with a Grade 3 turf toe injury, a condition serious enough to sideline most players for months. NFL Network’s Ian Rapoport reported that Burrow underwent surgery and is expected to miss “at least three months.” That puts his earliest possible return in late December, lining up with Week 16 against the Miami Dolphins.The timeline, however, is far from guaranteed. FOX Sports’ Jay Glazer questioned whether the three-month window is realistic, calling it “very aggressive.” He noted, “They’re saying three months, I don’t see three months being an actual timeline. I think more so [Burrow has] a chance [to return] if they make the playoffs, but only because it’s Joe Burrow. Somebody else, I’d say no. But he has that Mamba Mentality, maybe yes. It’s such a difficult injury to return from.”That reality means the Bengals must prepare for the likelihood that Burrow may not return during the regular season.Even in a best-case scenario, his availability depends heavily on whether Cincinnati remains in the postseason hunt.The loss of Burrow immediately reshaped expectations for the Bengals, who entered 2025 with legitimate Super Bowl aspirations. NEW DELHI: Former Pakistani cricketers have sharply criticised pacer Haris Rauf’s performance in the Asia Cup 2025 final against defending champions India, where he conceded 50 runs in four overs. The veterans particularly questioned his death-over bowling and captain Salman Ali Agha’s decision to bring him on during a crucial phase as India chased a modest 147 runs to win the title.Former Pakistan batter Mohammad Yousuf expressed concerns about Rauf’s performance at the death overs.“We have to understand Haris Rauf – how many matches he has blown away at the end (“marwaa diya”). He shouldn’t be bowling the end overs. You remember the past world cups – har jagah isney maar khaayi hai (he has been smashed everywhere) … If he had bowled better, the scenario would have been different,” Yousuf said during a discussion on Samaa TV.Former wicketkeeper Kamran Akmal highlighted Rauf’s struggles in big matches.“Haris Rauf doesn’t win the big games. We all remember the Melbourne game (when Kohli hit Rauf for two sixes). The captain has to understand which bowler needs to be used in such situations.We are not learning, keep making mistakes,” Akmal told ARY News.Tauseef Ahmed, former Pakistan offspinner, questioned Rauf’s repeated poor performances in crucial moments.“We say anything can happen in cricket. But why do such things only happen to Haris Rauf in cricket? We have other bowlers who are outside. Stop the stories of franchise cricket. End franchise’s influence. Only Haris Rauf could have done this. Not Hasan Ali or another youngster. We also have been hit in our time, but not every time like this.”The match situation became critical when Rauf was brought in for the 15th over, after spinners had conceded only 13 runs in three overs. Rauf gave away 17 runs in that over, shifting momentum firmly towards India.Mohammad Amir, former fast bowler, criticized the tactical decision."It was a huge mistake to give Rauf that over. The spinners had created a momentum towards you. But they removed the spinner Saim and brought in the fast bowler Rauf, and that changed the momentum completely. No doubt he is your wicket-taking bowler, but that situation demanded spinners to be bowled. You wouldn’t have lost this game. Shaheen and Faheem had bowled so well in the powerplay,” Amir said on his YouTube channel.Former captain Rashid Latif suggested alternative bowling options.“Haris Rauf shouldn’t have bowled that over. Abrar Ahmed should have bowled that and when he came back, he had to change ends. That’s very important for a spinner. Saim could have bowled, we never gave Mohammad Nawaz,” Rashid said on Geo News.

However, confirming it through photo-matching services proved difficult due to the lack of high-resolution images. After a detour through another auction house, the jersey finally resurfaced for this high-profile sale.Beyond the staggering price tag, this jersey embodies Gretzky’s enduring legacy. He retired as the NHL’s all-time leader in goals, assists, and points, and even more than two decades later, his influence on the game remains unmatched. The fact that the jersey was on his back as he notched his final point only amplifies its importance.Also Read: The Gretzky effect: How Wayne Gretzky made hockey cool in Hollywood and changed the NHL forever For fans, the jersey is more than a collectible—it’s a piece of living history. It captures the moment the hockey world bid farewell to its brightest star, a player who transformed the sport globally. With the auction date approaching, anticipation is building to see just how high the final bid will climb for one of hockey’s most treasured artifacts.

Ben Harburg has become a major name in Saudi football after buying a team in the pro league this year. As an American businessman with a sharp eye for investments, he brings fresh energy to the sport in the Middle East. His goal is to grow the club step by step while building ties with local fans and players. This story shows how one outsider's vision could change the game for good.Ben Harburg started his career in finance, where he learned to spot good chances in different markets across the globe. He set up his own firm that deals with business deals and growth projects, and it now owns part of a club in Europe too. For his first step into Saudi football, Harburg picked Al Kholood since it gave him space to try new ideas away from the heavy history of bigger teams in the league.The club's spot in a busy town full of loyal fans made the choice even better for him during the summer buyout. This deal fits into Saudi Arabia's push to let more outside owners join and lift the whole league's standing on the world stage. On top of that, Harburg moved to the area to oversee operations closely and build genuine connections with the people who support the team every day.Because of this, his role signals a new wave of mixed owners in the pro league that might encourage others to jump in soon.He brought in skilled people from top clubs abroad to run the day-to-day work and share tested ways to improve the setup.Also Read: "I have never felt so welcome anywhere": Al-Kholood's new owner Ben Harburg surprises Saudi Pro League with community-first plan Harburg puts a lot of effort into making a firm ground for the club by managing funds in a smart way and using profits to upgrade spots for players and workers. He wants to start youth camps that teach skills to kids early on so they can grow into stars fit for the national side. By doing this, the team skips the high costs of signing big-name players and builds its own group through steady practice and help programs.Fans stay at the heart of his big picture as he hopes to make them feel key to each match and the choice the club makes. This means using new tech to post updates and grow closer links with supporters on social sites and other spots. Plus, Harburg judges wins by how many from his club make it to the country's top team, which links to large events like World Cups coming up.As a result, these moves seek to place the club with the top groups without needing giant funds from main backers that rivals get. He trusts in the drive from local crowds and the building work Saudi Arabia does to push the league higher worldwide. So, his plan mixes people's focus with wise growth to leave a strong mark on football in the area for years.
